Faefrost,"2013-11-10T20:16:42.47Z","Great Dragon","

If you are looking for a Lego Dragon, and don't want to spring for a vastly expensive Ninjago one, Dragon Bolt is a great alternative. Great size and feel. Decent coloring. An oddly addictive wing flap mechanism. Good stuff.

• It's a nice big Dragon
  • It's highly Swooshable... flapflapflapflap!
  • The Brain Slug is that nice multi tone and really gives it some pop
  • Did I mention it's a nice BIG lego Dragon?
<ul><li>It's a little bare in spots and could use a bit more armoring here and there. Especially right at the breat bone area. Just snapping on another black chest piece really improves it.&nbsp
column2: • The Wings, while fun with the flapping are otherwise unposable and a little weird looking.
column3: • The head is great, but the lower jaw needs something more. It looks a little too technic ish.
column4: • The mech/robot details make it more difficult to reuse in places like Castle and LotR.

column1: A great Hero Factory foe, and also a decent crossover set for those seeking a nice playable articulated Dragon for other system scale themes. It has more weight and presence than other Lego Dragons such as most Ninjago and all Castle ones.
Comes in an enormous bag. Instructions go to Page 40.

149 pieces overall. Head piece looks great but kinda useless for MOCs. 4 black claws, cool parts. 8 lightning parts. 6 of the sword pieces used as wings. 4 transparent greenish yellow 3 sized armor parts. Blue savage planet claw pieces. Multi colored brain bug, that glows in the dark.
Went together more like a technic set. Very interesting build.
Looks brilliant When completed. Very nice looking dragon. Has moving jaws and flapping wings action.
